args.natural_language_statement: Let n be a fixed positive integer and let a,b,c be integers. Prove the following properties of congruence modulo n: a ≡ a (mod n); if a ≡ b (mod n) then b ≡ a (mod n); and if a ≡ b (mod n) and b ≡ c (mod n) then a ≡ c (mod n). Translate into Lean4 using Mathlib and end each statement with := by sorry.

args.content:
import Mathlib


/-- Let n be a fixed positive integer and let a,b,c be integers. Prove the following properties of congruence modulo n: a ≡ a (mod n); if a ≡ b (mod n) then b ≡ a (mod n); and if a ≡ b (mod n) and b ≡ c (mod n) then a ≡ c (mod n). Translate into Lean4 using Mathlib and end each statement with := by sorry. -/

namespace srdoty_alg_Z_n_824

variable {n : ℤ} {a b c : ℤ}

theorem cong_refl (n a : ℤ) : a ≡ a [ZMOD n] := by sorry

theorem cong_symm {n a b : ℤ} (h : a ≡ b [ZMOD n]) : b ≡ a [ZMOD n] := by sorry

theorem cong_trans {n a b c : ℤ} (hab : a ≡ b [ZMOD n]) (hbc : b ≡ c [ZMOD n]) : a ≡ c [ZMOD n] := by sorry

end srdoty_alg_Z_n_824

args.content:
import Mathlib

/- Basic properties of congruence modulo n for integers. -/

theorem int_modeq_refl (n a : Int) : a ≡ a [ZMOD n] := by sorry

theorem int_modeq_symm {n a b : Int} (h : a ≡ b [ZMOD n]) : b ≡ a [ZMOD n] := by sorry

theorem int_modeq_trans {n a b c : Int} (hab : a ≡ b [ZMOD n]) (hbc : b ≡ c [ZMOD n]) : a ≡ c [ZMOD n] := by sorry
